item.title: The place to which people go after death, and various ways of dying and being killed
item.summary: Death. The place to which the Bushmen go after death. The various ways of dying, and of being killed (L II.-12. 1173-1243, 13. 1244-1314. 14. 1315-1396). A description of the place where people go to after death as well as various ways of dying, including murder and death from starvation.
item.comments: 1) p.1173v: a knife with two sharp edges like those from Damaraland, 2) p.1174v: (26 May 1879) an opening called a 'grave' by ||kabbo's people, 3) p.1175v: a knife with one sharp edge, 4) p.1176v: the man who shoots well lives and the man who shoots 'amiss' dies of hunger, 5) See also A man is wounded by another by accident when out after springbok and ||kabbo tells of death, the hole, and the path of the First Bushmen, 6) This story is found in Book II-12
item.author: ||kabbo (Jantje) (II)
